Package org.apache.juneau.commons.collections

Class FilteredMap.Builder<K,V>

java.lang.Object
org.apache.juneau.commons.collections.FilteredMap.Builder<K,V>
Type Parameters:
K - The key type.
V - The value type.
Enclosing class:
FilteredMap<K,V>
public static class FilteredMap.Builder<K,V> extends Object
Builder for creating FilteredMap instances.
Example:

FilteredMap<String, Integer> map = FilteredMap .create(String.class, Integer.class) .filter((k, v) -> v != null && v > 0) .inner(new TreeMap<>()) .build();

  • Method Details

    • filter

      public FilteredMap.Builder<K,V> filter(BiPredicate<K,V> value)
      Sets the filter predicate that determines whether entries should be added.

      The predicate receives both the key and value of each entry. If it returns true, the entry is added to the map. If it returns false, the entry is silently ignored.

      This method is optional. If not called, the map will accept all entries (defaults to (k,v) -> true).

      This method can be called multiple times. When called multiple times, all filters are combined using AND logic - an entry must pass all filters to be added to the map.

      Example:

      // Filter out null values Builder<String, String> b = FilteredMap.create(String.class, String.class) .filter((k, v) -> v != null); // Filter based on both key and value Builder<String, Integer> b2 = FilteredMap.create(String.class, Integer.class) .filter((k, v) -> ! k.startsWith("_") && v != null && v > 0); // Multiple filters combined with AND Builder<String, Integer> b3 = FilteredMap.create(String.class, Integer.class) .filter((k, v) -> v != null) // First filter .filter((k, v) -> v > 0) // Second filter (ANDed with first) .filter((k, v) -> ! k.startsWith("_")); // Third filter (ANDed with previous)

      Parameters:
      value - The filter predicate. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      This object for method chaining.

    • inner

      public FilteredMap.Builder<K,V> inner(Map<K,V> value)
      Sets the underlying map instance that will store the filtered entries.

      If not specified, a new LinkedHashMap will be created during build().

      Example:

      // Use a TreeMap for sorted keys Builder<String, Integer> b = FilteredMap.create(String.class, Integer.class) .inner(new TreeMap<>()); // Use a ConcurrentHashMap for thread safety Builder<String, Integer> b2 = FilteredMap.create(String.class, Integer.class) .inner(new ConcurrentHashMap<>()); // Use an existing map Map<String, Integer> existing = new LinkedHashMap<>(); Builder<String, Integer> b3 = FilteredMap.create(String.class, Integer.class) .inner(existing);

      Parameters:
      value - The underlying map instance. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      This object for method chaining.

    • keyFunction

      public FilteredMap.Builder<K,V> keyFunction(Function<Object,K> value)
      Sets the function to use for converting keys when using FilteredMap.add(Object, Object).

      If specified, keys passed to FilteredMap.add(Object, Object) will be converted using this function before being added to the map. If not specified, keys must already be of the correct type (or Object.class is used if types were not specified, which accepts any type).

      Example:

      FilteredMap<String, Integer> map = FilteredMap .create(String.class, Integer.class) .filter((k, v) -> v != null) .keyFunction(o -> o.toString()) .build(); map.add(123, 5); // Key will be converted from Integer to String

      Parameters:
      value - The key conversion function. Can be null.
      Returns:
      This object for method chaining.

    • valueFunction

      public FilteredMap.Builder<K,V> valueFunction(Function<Object,V> value)
      Sets the function to use for converting values when using FilteredMap.add(Object, Object).

      If specified, values passed to FilteredMap.add(Object, Object) will be converted using this function before being added to the map. If not specified, values must already be of the correct type (or Object.class is used if types were not specified, which accepts any type).

      Example:

      FilteredMap<String, Integer> map = FilteredMap .create(String.class, Integer.class) .filter((k, v) -> v != null && v > 0) .valueFunction(o -> Integer.parseInt(o.toString())) .build(); map.add("key", "123"); // Value will be converted from String to Integer

      Parameters:
      value - The value conversion function. Can be null.
      Returns:
      This object for method chaining.

    • functions

      public FilteredMap.Builder<K,V> functions(Function<Object,K> keyFunction, Function<Object,V> valueFunction)
      Sets both the key and value conversion functions at once.

      This is a convenience method for setting both conversion functions in a single call.

      Example:

      FilteredMap<String, Integer> map = FilteredMap .create(String.class, Integer.class) .filter((k, v) -> v != null && v > 0) .functions( o -> o.toString(), // Key function o -> Integer.parseInt(o.toString()) // Value function ) .build();

      Parameters:
      keyFunction - The key conversion function. Can be null.
      valueFunction - The value conversion function. Can be null.
      Returns:
      This object for method chaining.

    • build

      public FilteredMap<K,V> build()
      Builds a new FilteredMap instance.

      If filter(BiPredicate) was not called, the map will accept all entries (defaults to (k,v) -> true).

      Returns:
      A new filtered map instance.
